# Filename: CMakeLists-GIT.txt
# Description: Skeleton example to be used for GIT based 3rd party library
#   you want to include in your project. Copy this skeleton directory and
#   rename it. Rename this file as CMakeLists.txt and adjust the POST BUILD
#   copy commands below to copy the (includes, binaries, and libraries) to
#   the external libraries folder as shown below.
# Modification Log:
# 2012-01-03 Initial version
#

# This file requires CMake version 2.8
cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 2.8)

# Give this 3rd party skeleton download, configure, install project a name
project(GetSkeleton)

# Define the install directory as a subdirectory of this folder
set(Skeleton_PREFIX "${PROJECT_BINARY_DIR}")
set(Skeleton_INSTALL_DIR "${PROJECT_BINARY_DIR}")
set(Skeleton_CMAKE_ARGS -DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=${Skeleton_INSTALL_DIR})

# Add this External Skeleton project
ExternalProject_Add(GetSkeleton
  PREFIX ${Skeleton_PREFIX}
  GIT_REPOSITORY https://github.com/Skeleton/Skeleton.git
  INSTALL_DIR ${Skeleton_INSTALL_DIR}
  CMAKE_ARGS ${Skeleton_CMAKE_ARGS}
)

# Create some special copy rules to transfer the files from this Skeleton
# project to the external directory for use with our system.
